alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 6:09AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT THE BOUNDARY WATERS CANOE AREA WILDERNESS... Strong to severe thunderstorms will affect the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, mainly late this evening into the overnight hours. It`s possible a strong to severe storm could develop during the afternoon but the main period is later. The storms will be capable of erratic and gusty winds of 50 to 70 mph, hail up to half- dollar size, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and heavy rainfall, which may lead to localized flooding of creeks, streams, and low-lying areas. Campers should take extra precautions in order to secure campsites and make a plan in case of severe weather. Check campsites for possible hazards, including standing dead trees or limbs, as well as low spots where water can pool. Move tents away from creeks and rivers in case of flash flooding. Prepare to protect yourself from large hail using sleeping bags or other padded items. Monitor NOAA Weather Radio for updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
